alert.note: Alert for Clinton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 04 at 12:08PM EDT until April 09 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Grand River near Comstock Park affecting Kent County. Red Cedar River At East Lansing affecting Ingham County. Maple River at Maple Rapids affecting Clinton County. Thornapple River Above Hastings affecting Barry County. .Another 0.5 to 1.0 inches of rain fell overnight, which is mostly prolonging the expected flood crests, but not making them significantly worse. Unfortunately, several rounds of thunderstorms expected tonight and tomorrow will add additional water into the system, which could push these crests higher and potentially bring additional locations above flood levels. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Maple River at Maple Rapids. * WHEN...From late tonight to Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Expect minor flooding of County Line Road and a home along County Line Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 8.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 9.4 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.4 feet on 04/29/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.
